Class DirectoryChooser

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  jpo.DirectoryChooser
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class DirectoryChooser
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

An object of this class displays a text field with a dropdown button to select the previously used directories and has a button next to it which allows you to bring up a filechooser. The selected directory is validated as to whether it exists and is writable. If this is not the case the characters of the textfield are displayed in red.

Author:
Richard Eigenmann
See Also:
Serialized Form

Parameters:
chooserTitle - the title for a JFileChooser window
validationType - The type of validation that must be performed on the directory. Can either be DIR_MUST_EXIST or DIR_MUST_BE_WRITABLE

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
gets the text from the field

checkDirectory

public boolean checkDirectory()
this method verifies that the path specified in the thumbnailPathJTextField is valid. It sets the color of the font to red if this is not ok and returns false to the caller. If all is fine it returns true.

Returns:
returns true if the directory passes the validation, false if it doesn't

checkDirectory

public static boolean checkDirectory(java.io.File testDir,
                                     int validationType)
test the supplied File on whether it is a directory and whether is can be written to.
